definitions.definition: shared by, typical of, or relating to a whole group of similar things, rather than to any particular thing:
examples: The new range of engines all had a generic problem with their fan blades.

definitions.definition: generic drugs or other products do not have a trademark and are sold without the name of the company that produced them
a product, especially a drug, that is no longer owned or legally controlled by a particular company:
examples: The biggest difference between the brand-name drugs and the generics is price.
